    Experiences

    I enjoy tracking on the meaningful experiences I've had over my career, providing me a robust list of the things that have impacted my professional life. Here is a not so complete list of experiences that have contribute to who I am today.

    2023

    • December - I published my book on the world of APis, The API-First Transformation.

    2021

    • June - I started the Breaking Changes podcast, looking at the space through the lens of business and engineering leadership.
    • January - I became the co-chair for the OpenAPI Initiative (OAI) business governing group (OAI).

    2020

    • December - I presented on API management to the United Nations Enviornmental Programme.
    • November - I become a technical advisor to the OpenTravel Alliance.
    • August - I launched Postman's partner program.

    2019

    • October - Interviewed by Marsh Gardiner at the API Specifications Conference (ASC) as part of a fireside chat.
    • September - Joined Postman as their Chief Evangelist.
    • January - Joined F5 Networks as their API architect.

    2018

    • July - Spoke at the POST/CON 2018 conference in Francisco, CA
    • August - Spoke at the Blue Button 2.0 Developer Conference At the White House
    • September - Helped organize the 9th edition of my API Strategy & Practice conference
    • October - Worked with the European Commission as part of their member state API research program

    2017

    • July - I responded to the Department of Veterans Affairs API RFI
    • July - Provided feedback to the FOIA API team on the next genertion of the API
    • July - I presented to the Oxford English Dictionary teams about APIs in Oxford, England
    • July - I Spoke At Red Hat Event On Microservices In Washington DC
    • August - I spoke on CA panel about APIs in the enterprise in Boulder, CO
    • August - I presented to the GSA's CIO Office Quarterly API Group In Washington DC
    • August - I presented at a Hack Day for Social Good at Optimizely in San Francisco, CA
    • November - Put on API Straregy & Practice with Linux Foundation and the OAI in Portand, ORG

    2016

    • April - I participated in the Personal APIs event at Davidson College in North Carolina
    • May - Invested the Spring and Summer Into Drone Recovery
    • November - Put on API Straregy & Practice in Boston, TX
    • November - I keynoted the Defrag Conference in Broomfield, CO

    2015

    • January - Went to California State University Channel Islands to talk APIs with tech team
    • February - Spoke at APIDays Sydney
    • February - Published Internet of Things White Paper with Gigaom
    • April - Put on API Days Berlin & APIStrat Europe in Berlin, Germany
    • May - Spoke at API Days Mediteranea in Barcelona
    • May - Conducted APIStrat Workshops at Gluecon in Colorado
    • May - Spoke at Swagger API Mettup at Glueecon in Colorado
    • May - Spoke at Gluecon in Colorado
    • June - Spoke at University API & Domains (UAD) Workshop in Utah
    • June - Spoke on Internet of Things at API Days in San Francisco
    • July - My Work Covered in InfoWorld
    • August - Received a Knight Foundation Prototype Grant for My Open Data Work
    • November - Put on API Straregy & Practice in Austin, TX

    2014

    • January - Participated in panel discussion at Educon in Philadelphia
    • March - Organized and Spoke at API Strategy & Practice Amsterdam
    • April - Spoke at Domain Incubator at Emory University
    • April - Spoke at IBM Impact in Las Vegas
    • April - Spoke and participated in EDx course planning session at UT Arlington
    • May - Spoke at APIDays Berlin
    • May - I Moderated A Panel Discussion Between GSA, NASA, White House in Maryland
    • May - Organized Un-Workshops At Gluecon in Colorado
    • May - Spoke At API Days Mediteranea in Barcelona
    • June - Spoke At The API Craft Meetup in San Francisco
    • June - Spoke At API Days in San Francisco
    • June - Spoke At The Edmunds API Summit in Santa Monica
    • July - Moderated Hypermedia Panel at API-Craft in Detroit
    • September - Particpated In The Using Power Grid Open Data Initiatives At Smart Grid Interoperability 2014
    • September - Moderated An API Panel at API360 in Washington D.C at the Newseum with Dave Goldberg (@davidgoldberg) of Capital One, Adam Martin (adamjmartin) of the Broadcasting Board of Governors, Frank Febbraro (@febbraro) of Phase2 Technology, and Lisa Wolfisch (@govgrrl) of the U.S. Census Bureau
    • September - Moderated An Open Data Panel at API360 in Washington D.C at the Newseum with Alex Howard (@digiphile) of Tech Republic, Ian Schuler (@ianschuler) of Development Seed, and Stephen Davenport (@davenportsteve) of the World Bank
    • November - Spoke with computer science class at Loyala Marymount University

    2013

    • January - Spoke at the DC API Meetup
    • February - Organized and Spoke at API Strategy & Practice New York
    • February - Spoke at API User Group Meetup at Saleforce in San Francisco, California
    • February - Conducted an Intel Workshop at Apps World in San Francisco, California
    • April - Spoke at Microsoft BizSpark Startup Meetup in San Francisco, California
    • May - Spoke at DFW API Professional Meetup in Dallas, Texas
    • May - Spoke at APIDays Mediterranea in Barcelona, Spain
    • May - One of Computer Scientists Who Signed Amicus Brief Filed By EFF In The Oracle vs. Google API Copyright Case
    • June - Became a Presidential Innovation Fellow
    • September - Spoke at the DC API Meetup
    • October - Spoke At OpenVA, Virginias First Annual Open and Digital Learning Resources Conference
    • October - Organized and Spoke at API Strategy And Practice San Francisco
    • October - Published API Strategy White Paper for GigaOm
    • November - Launched API Commons at Defrag Conference in Colorado
    • November - Spoke with computer science class at Loyala Marymount University
    • November - Began working on prototype of a FAFSA API
    • December - Spoke at APIDays in Paris
    • December - Participated in the Education Data Jam at Standford with the White House

    2012

    • October - Spoke to the first round of Presidential Innovation Fellows in Washington, DC
    • October - Spoke with computer science class at Loyala Marymount University

    2011

    • April - Wrote first blog post on ProgrammableWeb
    • December - Began working as API Evangelist for CityGrid in West Hollywood

    2010

    • October - Began working as API Evangelist for Mimeo in New York City
    • July - Began working on my API Evangelist research, which would become APIEvangelist.com

    2008

    • February - Became social media director at Altrec in Bend, Oregon
    • October - Becme VP of Technology at Web Events Global in Roseville, CA

    2007

    • January - Started my social media marketing company called Social Media Squad

    2005

    • September - Became lead developer at Palo Alto Software in Eugene, Oregon

    2004

    • June - Help start real estate startup IDX in Eugene, Oregon

    2003

    • August - Became lead developer at auto and equipment dealer Vihn.net in Eugene, Oregon

    2002

    • September - Became lead DBA at Tactical Marketing Ventures in Westmister, Colorado

    2000

    • January - Started my web development company Original Web Solutions in Eugene, Oregon

    1999

    • March - Became lead application developer at nonprofit tech provider Netcorps in Eugene, OR

    1994

    • February - Started a series of music promotion companies ending with PicHitz Entertainment

    1989

    • March - Became lead database developer at Mt Rose Sotware
